sections.title: Human development
sections.paragraphs:
According to 2018 [[Human Development Index|HDI]] statistical update (with data for 2017) compared to all its neighboring countries Armenia has:

* the lowest coefficient of human inequality,
* the lowest gender inequality (ranked 55th on [[Gender Inequality Index]]), 
* highest percentage of men and highest percentage of women with at least some secondary education,
* highest share of seats in parliament held by women,
* highest share of women who reported to feel safe,
* highest GDP growth rate.  <ref name=":5">{{Cite web|url=http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/2018_human_development_statistical_update.pdf|title=HUMAN DEVELOPMENT INDICES AND INDICATORS: 2018 STATISTICAL UPDATE|last=|first=|date=|website=|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=}}</ref>

Since 1990 Armenia recorded steady growth of average annual [[Human Development Index|HDI]] scores in every reported period (1990–2000, 2000–2010, 2010–2017).<ref name=":5" />

According to 2016 [[Sustainable Society Index]] Armenia has higher rank of Human Wellbeing than all its neighbours. At the same time its Economic Wellbeing rank is below neighbouring countries.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ssfindex.com/results/ranking-all-countries/|title=Ranking all countries – Sustainable Society Index|language=en-US|access-date=2019-12-02}}</ref>

2011 census counted 539 394 persons (19.4% of population above 6 years age) with higher professional education.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=https://www.armstat.am/file/article/1._bajin_5_583-664.pdf|title=Armenian 2011 census data, chapter 5|last=|first=|date=|website=|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=}}</ref>

=== Life expectancy === According to 2018 [[Human Development Index|HDI]] statistical update compared to all its neighboring countries Armenia has highest health expenditures as percentage of GDP and highest healthy life expectancy at birth. In 2016 the average life expectancy at birth for males was 71.6 years and for females was 78.3 years, with the average at 75.0 years. After a setback during 1986-1996 mostly due to the [[1988 Armenian earthquake|Spitak Earthquake]] and the [[Nagorno-Karabakh War]], Armenia regained its position and was consistently among the top three former Soviet republics during 1997-2016, topping the list in 2007.{{Cite web|url=https://www.google.com/publicdata/explore?ds=d5bncppjof8f9_&ctype=c&strail=false&bcs=d&nselm=s&met_y=sp_dyn_le00_in&scale_y=lin&ind_y=false&idim=country:AZE:GEO:EST:KAZ:LVA:MDA:RUS:TJK:TKM:UKR:LTU:KGZ:BLR:ARM:XKX&ifdim=country:region:ECS&tunit=Y&pit=1193079600000&hl=en&dl=en&ind=false&icfg|title=World Development Indicators - Google Public Data Explorer|last=|first=|date=|website=www.google.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2018-10-23}} During the [[Armenian Soviet Socialist Republic|Soviet period]], life expectancy was traditionally high in Armenia and topped all other republics of [[Soviet Union|USSR]] and most of countries in Eastern Europe in 1978-1980.{{Cite web|url=https://www.google.com/publicdata/explore?ds=d5bncppjof8f9_&ctype=c&strail=false&bcs=d&nselm=s&met_y=sp_dyn_le00_in&scale_y=lin&ind_y=false&idim=country:AZE:GEO:EST:KAZ:LVA:MDA:RUS:TJK:TKM:UKR:LTU:KGZ:BLR:ARM&ifdim=country:region:ECS&tunit=Y&pit=277934400000&hl=en&dl=en&ind=false&icfg|title=World Development Indicators - Google Public Data Explorer|last=|first=|date=|website=www.google.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2018-10-23}}{{Cite web|url=https://d-zykin.livejournal.com/275731.html|title=Продолжительность жизни по республикам СССР|last=d_zykin|date=2016-01-02|website=Журнал Летучего Мыша: каждому свое и подобное к подобному|access-date=2018-10-23}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Period !Life expectancy in

sections.title: Life expectancy
sections.paragraphs:
According to 2018 [[Human Development Index|HDI]] statistical update compared to all its neighboring countries Armenia has highest health expenditures as percentage of GDP and highest healthy life expectancy at birth. In 2016 the average life expectancy at birth for males was 71.6 years and for females was 78.3 years, with the average at 75.0 years. After a setback during 1986-1996 mostly due to the [[1988 Armenian earthquake|Spitak Earthquake]] and the [[Nagorno-Karabakh War]], Armenia regained its position and was consistently among the top three former Soviet republics during 1997-2016, topping the list in 2007.{{Cite web|url=https://www.google.com/publicdata/explore?ds=d5bncppjof8f9_&ctype=c&strail=false&bcs=d&nselm=s&met_y=sp_dyn_le00_in&scale_y=lin&ind_y=false&idim=country:AZE:GEO:EST:KAZ:LVA:MDA:RUS:TJK:TKM:UKR:LTU:KGZ:BLR:ARM:XKX&ifdim=country:region:ECS&tunit=Y&pit=1193079600000&hl=en&dl=en&ind=false&icfg|title=World Development Indicators - Google Public Data Explorer|last=|first=|date=|website=www.google.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2018-10-23}} During the [[Armenian Soviet Socialist Republic|Soviet period]], life expectancy was traditionally high in Armenia and topped all other republics of [[Soviet Union|USSR]] and most of countries in Eastern Europe in 1978-1980.{{Cite web|url=https://www.google.com/publicdata/explore?ds=d5bncppjof8f9_&ctype=c&strail=false&bcs=d&nselm=s&met_y=sp_dyn_le00_in&scale_y=lin&ind_y=false&idim=country:AZE:GEO:EST:KAZ:LVA:MDA:RUS:TJK:TKM:UKR:LTU:KGZ:BLR:ARM&ifdim=country:region:ECS&tunit=Y&pit=277934400000&hl=en&dl=en&ind=false&icfg|title=World Development Indicators - Google Public Data Explorer|last=|first=|date=|website=www.google.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2018-10-23}}{{Cite web|url=https://d-zykin.livejournal.com/275731.html|title=Продолжительность жизни по республикам СССР|last=d_zykin|date=2016-01-02|website=Журнал Летучего Мыша: каждому свое и подобное к подобному|access-date=2018-10-23}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Period !Life expectancy in

sections.paragraphs:

In 2016 natural increase of population comprised 12 366 persons and the crude rate of natural increase made 4.1‰, per 1000 population, decreasing by 0.4 pro mile points compared to the previous year.<ref name=":0" />

After double-digit (in pro mile) crude natural increase rates during 1982-1992 these did not exceed 5.5 after 1998. At regional level slightly better situation is in Yerevan city, where the value of 5.5 is consistently being surpassed since 2009. Particularly weak is natural increase in [[Tavush Province|Tavush]] and [[Syunik Province|Syunik]] provinces, not much better off are [[Lori Province|Lori]] and [[Vayots Dzor Province|Vayots Dzo]]<nowiki/>r provinces.<ref name=":0" />

The mean age of mother at birth was 26.8 years and at first birth it was 24.7 years in 2016.<ref name=":0" /> Adolecent birth rate as well as share of women married at age of 18 was lowest in Armenia compared to its neighboring countries.<ref name=":5" />

sections.title: Languages
sections.paragraphs:
[[Armenian language|Armenian]] is the only official language.

2001 census data: [[Armenian language|Armenian]] 97.7%, [[Kurdish language|Kurdish]] 1%, [[Russian language|Russian]] 0.9%, and other 0.4%.

2011 census data: Native languages were reported as follows: [[Armenian language|Armenian]] - 2,956,615, [[Yezidi language|Yezidian]] -  30,973, [[Russian language|Russian]] - 23,484, [[Assyrian Neo-Aramaic|Assyrian]] - 2,402, [[Kurdish languages|Kurdish]] - 2,030.<ref name=":4" />

Armenia is a member of the [[La Francophonie]] and hosted its annual summit in 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://en.168.am/2018/10/08/28632.html|title=La Francophonie Ministerial Conference kicks off with moment of silence in honor of late Charles Aznavour|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=}}</ref>

The largest communities of the ethnic [[Armenian diaspora]] are fluent in [[Russian language|Russian]] and [[English language|English]].

sections.title: Migration
sections.paragraphs:
[[File:Net migration per 1000 in Armenia.png|thumb|450x450px|Annual net migration rate (per 1000 population). Source data and projections (2019) from UN.]]
Compared it is neighbouring countries Armenia has highest share immigrants (6.5% of total population, 2017 data).<ref name=":5" />

The estimated number of population net migration is -24.8 thousand persons, according to the Integrated living conditions survey of households of 2016; for urban population -13.8 thousand and for rural population -11.0 thousand persons.<ref name=":0" />

24.9% of households were involved in external and internal migration processes over the period of 2013- 2016. Migration directions were distributed as follows: 12% - internal, 10.5% - [[Republic of Artsakh]], rest (76.4%) - international (of which 89.8% - [[Russia]]). Among household members of age 15 and above, who left the place of their permanent residence in 2013-2016 for 3 months and longer and had not returned as of 2016, 11.9% were in Armenia, 13.0% in Artsakh, and 75.1% in other countries, predominantly in the Russian Federation. More than 54% of migrant household members of the age 15 years and above sent money and/ or goods to their families/relatives/friends within the 12 months preceding the survey.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.armstat.am/file/article/demog_2017_7.pdf|title=The Demographic Handbook of Armenia, 2017 - Migration|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=}}</ref>

According to 2019 UN data emigration rate averaged to annually 1.7 per 1000 inhabitants in years 2015-2020 and is expected to remain same until year 2045. These are below average emigration rate of 11.5 per 1000 in years 2000-2010 and even below the emigration rate of 3.2 per 1000 in years 1980-1985.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://population.un.org/wpp/DataQuery/|title=World Population Prospects - Population Division - United Nations|website=population.un.org|access-date=2019-10-30}}</ref>

sections.title: Wealth and poverty
sections.paragraphs:
=== Inequality ===
Out of 41 [[emerging economies]] Armenia was among only 4, which recorded rising inequality (measured by [[Gini coefficient]]) in years 2007-2015.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://documents.worldbank.org/curated/en/816281518818814423/pdf/2019-WDR-Report.pdf|title=WORLD DEVELOPMENT REPORT 2019|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=}}</ref> 

=== Wealth ===
According to Global Wealth Report prepared by Credit Suisse [[List of countries by wealth per adult|mean wealth per adult]] in Armenia in 2019 is estimated at $19,517 rising 9 times from estimated $2,177 in year 2000.  Mean wealth per adult in Armenia surpasses corresponding values for neighboring countries Georgia and Azerbaijan by over 50%, all [[Commonwealth of Independent States|CIS]] countries except Russia and Kazakhstan, and neighboring Iran. Growth rate of mean wealth per adult between 2000 and 2019 with the value of 9 times beats all neighboring countries, most of CIS countries and even all Baltic countries (Estonia, Lithuania, Latvia). <ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.credit-suisse.com/about-us/en/reports-research/global-wealth-report.html|title=Global wealth report|website=Credit Suisse|language=en|access-date=2019-10-23}}</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=https://www.credit-suisse.com/media/assets/corporate/docs/about-us/research/publications/global-wealth-databook-2019.pdf|title=Global wealth databook 2019|last=|first=|date=|website=|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=}}</ref>

Median wealth per adult is reported at $8,309 in 2019, above the world average, rising 9.6 times from $862 in year 2000. <ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" />

Between 2000 and 2019 average debts per adult grew 28.7 times to $1,261, or 6.5% of wealth per adult (below 11.9% world average). <ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" />

55% of adults own less than $10,000, 42.7% '''—''' $10,000-$100,000, 2.2% '''—''' $100,000-$1 million and 0.1% '''—''' over $1 million. The share of adults owning less than $10,000 with the value of 55% is less than corresponding value in each of CIS countries, neighboring Iran and Turkey, as well as the world average. Gini coefficient  for wealth is reported at 66.3%, less than 82.4% European average and 88.5% world average. <ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" />

=== Poverty ===
According to official data 29.4% of population was below poverty line in year 2016. The poverty indicators in [[Shirak Province|Shirak]], [[Lori Province|Lori]], [[Kotayk Province|Kotayk]], [[Tavush Province|Tavush]] and [[Armavir Province|Armavir]] provinces are higher than the country average. The highest poverty rate in the country has been recorded in [[Shirak Province|Shirak]] province, where 46% of the population is below the poverty line. To overcome poverty, Armenia would need AMD 63.2 billion, or an amount equal to 1.2% of GDP, in addition to the resources already allocated for social assistance, assuming that such assistance would be efficiently targeted to the poor only.<ref name=":1" />

In terms of international poverty line corresponding to US$1.25 at 2005 PPP poverty in Armenia went down from 19.3% in year 2001 to 1.5% in year 2008 and remained nearly unchanged until year 2015 moving in range 1.5% - 2.7%.<ref name=":1" />
